comments:
build N20050509

Noticed the following in the console output for this build.
The undo support is being shutdown during WorkbenchPlugin.stop, and is disposing
operations that come from higher level plug-ins.
By this time, however, higher level plug-ins have already been stopped.

Recommend shutting down the undo support during Workbench.shutdown() instead of
WorkbenchPlugin.stop.

Suggestion seems reasonable/simple.  Will consider this one for M7/RC0.

The operation support is managed in the WorkbenchPlugin.  
In Workbench.shutdown(), the WorkbenchPlugin is reset.  In the reset method 
all the other workbench plugin resources are disposed.

So I think the cleanest approach is to move the disposal code from 
WorkbenchPlugin.stop() to WorkbenchPlugin.reset().
Verified that the code has moved but I don't know how to reproduce the problem.
